main: ^Hello, ma'am. I noticed that you are picking flowers.
^Those are not allowed to be picked in this area.
^But, you lady, I've been picking flowers here for years!
Understand: ^Picking them can harm their distribution and the ecosystem as a whole.
^How can a dozen flowers less be that harmful for the other plants and animals?
^There are a lot more left here.
^A dozen less flowers, could also mean a dozen less bees and butterflies.
^Without them, the reproduction of other plants and flowers can be affected.
^Don't go teaching me! Just let me enjoy these flowers.
^I'm not picking that many, am I?
^You may enjoy them in a different way.
^Maybe take a photo of the flowers, or try to paint them.
^You youngins and your gadgets. I'd rather have a bouquet on the table.
^Fine, I will not pick anymore flowers from here.
^But don't expect me to be happy about it!
^It was never my intention to upset you.
^I hope you can understand the reasoning behind the rules.
Direct: ^Ma'am, it doesn't matter if people did or did not complain about what you're doing.
^So you want me to have an empty table without any floral decorations on it?
^Ma'am, I'm not saying that. I'm just saying you can go somewhere else.
^The supermarket also has flowers you can put on your table.
^Just don't get your flowers from here.
^Are you always this inhospitable to other people coming here?
^I'm heading out of this miserable forest, goodbye!
